problem.p: Which of the following are true?

choicegroup.choice: Functional programming is easier to follow and debug whereas imparative programming requires more effort to understand
Functional programming allows larger problems to be broken down into smaller ones

div.p: Functional Programming: From the name we can assume fast that it focuses on functions. Also, in fucntional programming we are interested in what information is needed to and transformations are required/
Programming: Also uses functions and mostly loops and conditionals, like 'if' or 'else'. In imperitive programming we are interested in how to perform tasks and in tracking state changes.
